result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desmond L Love

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Oliver C Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Oliver C Smith.  Attorney Matthew Torbenson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Court notes that defendant has filed a number of pro se bail motions.
Court holds colloquy with defendant as to pro se filings; defendant has counsel and Court does not typically review pro se filings when represented by counsel.
Court reviews history of case and charges with the parties.
For reasons stated on the record, Court denies any modification to bail at this time.

Case remains scheduled for final pre-trial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Desmond L Love in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Desmond L Love.  Attorney Patricia Irene Daugherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Prompt Disposition filed. Defendant withdraws Prompt Disposition request; possibly to file at a later date. Discovery discussion placed on the record. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in room 310 of the Safety Building, with Judge Franke. Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Desmond L Love not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin appeared by video for Desmond L Love.  Attorney Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel addresses the prompt disposition filed. Court further orders defense counsel to have the defendant sign the prompt dispo, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned for a status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

REQUEST FOR PROMPT DISPOSITION.
Received September 26, 2022.
Expires January 24, 2023.
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF RETAINER

Adjustment Number: 22A 086686,
Payable Number: 1031432,
Receipt Number: 22RP036447,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Desmond L Love not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin appeared by video for Desmond L Love.  Attorney Amy Spanczak appeared on behalf of Patricia Irene Daugherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Court informs attorney Chernin that a notice of retainer has yet to be filed and orders him to do such. Defense counsel agrees, and advises that he still awaiting a global offer from the state. State urges defense to reach out to Attorney Daugherty for further discussion. Court schedules next court date for a Status Conference. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Desmond L Love not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Patricia Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Court informs attorney Chernin that a notice of retainer has yet to be filed and orders him to do such. Defense counsel agrees, and requests an additional Status Conference date due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Desmond L Love not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Patricia Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Court informs attorney Chernin that a notice of retainer has yet to be filed and orders him to do such. Defense counsel agrees, and advises that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the state. Court schedules next court date for a Status Conference, and sets 07/26/2022 deadline for the state to turn over any outstanding discovery and an offer to defense. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desmond L Love in court with attorney Michael Chernin appear in person .  Defendant Desmond L Love in custody.  Greg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with co-defs:  Tommy Lee Love Jr. and Oliver Smith
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision LEVEL 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Desmond L Love in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Desmond L Love in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Desmond L Love appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
